resources.string: Your goal should be clear and specific, otherwise you won\'t be able to focus your efforts or feel truly motivated to achieve it.
Use the 5 Ws to help you answer this question:
What do I want to accomplish?
Which resources or limits are involved?
I will eat a minimum of 5 servings of fruits and vegetables daily.
I will work out a minimum of 20 minutes per day, three days a week.
For the next year, I will save 15% of every paycheck, which is between $200-$300.
How will this goal be measured?

It\'s important to have measurable goals, so that you can track your progress and stay motivated. Assessing progress helps you to stay focused, meet your deadlines, and feel the excitement of getting closer to achieving your goal.
Use the following questions to help you answer this question:
How will I know when it is accomplished?
The goal is to go grocery shopping once a week and buy X amount of veggies and fruits that I can cut up in daily serving sizes.
I will measure my progress using a fitness tracker and calendar, making sure I complete my 20-minute workouts.
My bank will automatically take 15% and deposit it into another savings account, so I can see my progress.
